alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 4:56AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Grady, southeastern Oklahoma, southern Lincoln, Cleveland, northwestern Pottawatomie and southwestern McClain Counties through 545 AM CST... At 456 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Harrah to near Norman to 5 miles northeast of Bradley. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Newcastle, Blanchard, Tecumseh, Purcell, Choctaw, Noble, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, Stroud, Lexington, Pink, Goldsby, Meeker and Dibble. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 90 and 115. Interstate 40 between mile markers 161 and 194. Interstate 240 between mile markers 10 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
